description:
In the distant future, earthquakes and the effects of global warming have splintered Japanese society. Some struggle hand-to-mouth in the jungle-tangled ruins of civilization. Some live comfortably within the closed-off city of Atlas. Others lurk online, anonymously hacking the global economy. As nature grows more violent and the divide between classes expands, one spirited girl – Kuniko – must face her destiny and lead her people into the utopia of Atlas. The city's ruthless government isn't going to welcome them with open arms, but Kuniko won't give up until the gates of Atlas are kicked open for good – even if it means discovering that the promised land she dreamed of is built upon a foundation of twisted secrets and lies.

(Source: FUNimation)

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

__Doujin Circle:__ PASTA'S ESTAB.

[Website](https://www.pseweb.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Murata_Range)

Renji "Range" Murata is a Japanese artist and designer, known for his unique style combining Art Deco and Japanese Anime elements. He is best known for his conceptual design work on [Last Exile](https://anilist.co/anime/97/Last-Exile/) and [Blue Submarine No. 6](https://anilist.co/anime/1051/Blue-Submarine-No-6/).

He began his career in the early 1990s doing design work for video games, including having done the illustrations and character design for the fighting game series made by Atlus, *Power Instinct (豪血寺一族, Goketsuji Ichizoku)*. Since 1996 he left the game company and went on to become a freelance illustrator.

He runs a doujin circle called *PASTA'S ESTAB.*, which publishes collections of illustrations from his various works as well as some original goods. He has published more than a dozen books of his work, some of the most notable being *Robot*, *Rule*, and *futurhythm*. He was also voted "Best Artist of the Year" in the 2006 Seiun Award.

Since 2013 Murata has served as a faculty member at the Kyoto Seika University's Faculty of Manga(Character Design Course). Artist [You Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/105062/You-Shiina) is said to be among his students.

Range Murata selected an elite army of artists including [Yoshitoshi ABe](https://anilist.co/staff/96991/Yoshitoshi-ABe) and [Ugetsu Hakua](https://anilist.co/staff/102066/Ugetsu-Hakua) to contribute to *ROBOT* Volume 1 and ongoing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Power Instinct (Arcade, 1993) (Back Designer) | (SNES, 1994) (Ending Design) *As Range
- Power Instinct 2 (Arcade, 1994) (Scroll Design) *As Range
- Tengai (SEGA Saturn, 1996) (Guest Illustrator)
- Groove on Fight: Gōketsuji Ichizoku 3 (Arcade, 1997) (Designer) *As Range
- Wachenröder (SEGA Saturn, 1998) (Main Character Design)
- Blue Submarine No. 6: Saigetsu Fumahito - Time and Tide (Dreamcast, 2000) (Character Design)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku Tōkon: Matrimelee (Arcade/Neo Geo, 2003) (Illustration)
- Spy Fiction (PlayStation 2, 2003) (Character Designer)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Bonnō no Kaihō (PlayStation 2, 2006) (Illustration)
- Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Senzo Kuyō (Arcade, 2009) (Illustration) !~

[Official Website ](http://kuroishihitomi.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/kuroishihitomi) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1FXpihPpl4BxBlfGk3jfjx?autoplay=true)

Hitomi Kuroishi is a Japanese female singer-songwriter and composer, born in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture. She is credited simply as "Hitomi" for her vocals, not to be confused with J-pop singer "hitomi". Under Kim Studio (ケイ・アイ・エム; K, I, M). Used to be in 3-person unit Dolce Triade.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).
Tyler Walker is an ADR Director, Script writer and voice actor for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4685307000)

Originating from Studio Giants, currently freelance.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shinji_higuchi)

A notable director, special effects director and designer working on both tokusatsu and anime.

He started his career in 1984 working on Godzilla as a modeler for the monsters. The same year he joined Daicon Film, working on the special effects of the tokusatsu movie *Yamata no Orochi no Gyakushu*, and later became one of the founding members of [Studio Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/).

In 1992 he established Studio [GONZO](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) alongside other ex-Gainax staff [Shouji Murahama](https://anilist.co/staff/119708/), [Hiroshi Yamaguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/97308/) and [Mahiro Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/100392/).

His most notable achievements in tokusatsu are working as special effects director for *Gamera: Guardian of the Universe* (1995), and as both special effects director and director, on *Shin Godzilla* (2016).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.
